title: BioFluid Mix and Transfer - Part 1/2
author: Opentrons
description:
This protocol is part 2 of 2-part protocol designed to transfer biofluids and add the necessary reagents for preparation. After completing part 1 of the robot protocol and the centrifugation step, the samples are placed back on the deck of the OT-2 and this protocol is run. In this part, the samples, that are in the Nanosep Ultrafiltration tubes, are distributed to the sample vials and 0.5mL centrifuge tubes.



P300 Single-channel electronic pipette
P50 Single-channel electronic pipette
50/300uL Opentrons tipracks
Sample Vials (clean and empty)
0.5mL centrifuge tubes (clean and empty)
Nanosep 3K Ultrafiltration tubes (containing samples)
Custom container for holding cryovials
Custom container for holding centrifuge tubes (x2)



Slot 1/4/7: Custom container for holding centrifuge tubes, filled with Nanosep 3k Ultrafiltration tubes, containing samples from part 1
Slot 2/5/8: Custom container for holding centrifuge tubes, filled with 0.5mL centrifuge tubes
Slot 3/6/9: Custom container for holding cryovials, filled with sample vials
Slot 11: 50/300ul Opentrons tiprack
process:
Input your protocol parameters.
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support articles.
Hit "Run".
notes: If you have any questions about this protocol, please contact the Protocol Development Team by filling out the Troubleshooting Survey.

markdown.title: BioFluid Mix and Transfer - Part 1/2
markdown.author: [Opentrons](https://opentrons.com/)
markdown.description:
This protocol is part 2 of 2-part protocol designed to transfer biofluids and add the necessary reagents for preparation. After completing part 1 of the robot protocol and the centrifugation step, the samples are placed back on the deck of the OT-2 and this protocol is run. In this part, the samples, that are in the Nanosep Ultrafiltration tubes, are distributed to the sample vials and 0.5mL centrifuge tubes.

---
![Materials Needed](https://s3.amazonaws.com/opentrons-protocol-library-website/custom-README-images/001-General+Headings/materials.png)

* [P300 Single-channel electronic pipette](https://shop.opentrons.com/collections/ot-2-robot/products/single-channel-electronic-pipette)
* [P50 Single-channel electronic pipette](https://shop.opentrons.com/collections/ot-2-robot/products/single-channel-electronic-pipette)
* [50/300uL Opentrons tipracks](https://shop.opentrons.com/collections/opentrons-tips/products/opentrons-300ul-tips)
* Sample Vials (clean and empty)
* 0.5mL centrifuge tubes (clean and empty)
* Nanosep 3K Ultrafiltration tubes (containing samples)
* Custom container for holding cryovials
* Custom container for holding centrifuge tubes (x2)

---
![Setup](https://s3.amazonaws.com/opentrons-protocol-library-website/custom-README-images/001-General+Headings/Setup.png)

Slot 1/4/7: Custom container for holding centrifuge tubes, filled with Nanosep 3k Ultrafiltration tubes, containing samples from part 1

Slot 2/5/8: Custom container for holding centrifuge tubes, filled with 0.5mL centrifuge tubes

Slot 3/6/9: Custom container for holding cryovials, filled with sample vials

Slot 11: [50/300ul Opentrons tiprack](https://shop.opentrons.com/collections/opentrons-tips/products/opentrons-300ul-tips)
markdown.process:
1. Input your protocol parameters.
2. Download your protocol.
3. Upload your protocol into the [OT App](https://opentrons.com/ot-app).
4. Set up your deck according to the deck map.
5. Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our [support articles](https://support.opentrons.com/en/collections/1559720-guide-for-getting-started-with-the-ot-2).
6. Hit "Run".
markdown.notes: If you have any questions about this protocol, please contact the Protocol Development Team by filling out the [Troubleshooting Survey](https://protocol-troubleshooting.paperform.co/).
